content:
I am a final year Computer Science and Physics undergrad at BITS Pilani. Upon graduation, I will be joining the engineering team at Sundial, an early stage startup working to productise data science as it aligns perfectly with my desire to understand the big picture of the product development cycle.
I have been fortunate to have various opportunities to explore in my undergrad. With my internships at Google, where I worked on multimodal-information extraction, and at Microsoft Research where I worked on building a logical NLI dataset, I have developed a keen interest in the field of Artificial Intelligence. I am particularly interested in the aspects of explainability, interpretability and ethics. I am also excited about other emerging technologies like quantum computing and analog computing. I’m currently writing my thesis with Dr. Franco Nori’s Lab at RIKEN.
Please reach out to me if you’d like to chat with me!
  --
summary: I am a final year Computer Science and Physics undergrad at BITS Pilani. Upon graduation, I will be joining the engineering team at Sundial, an early stage startup working to productise data science as it aligns perfectly with my desire to understand the big picture of the product development cycle.
title: Khyati Jain

content: Studying the noise robustness of analog optimization methods for NP-Hard problems. More details to be updated soon!
summary: Studying the noise robustness of analog optimization methods for NP-Hard problems.
title: Combinatorial Optimization using Analog Computing

content: Building a logical Natural Language Inference dataset with verifiable proof steps using neuro-symbolic approach. We believe this would help build more reliable and interpretable systems, critical in real-world settings. Dataset to be released soon.
summary: Building a logical Natural Language Inference dataset
title: Neurosymbolic Multi-hop Reasoning

content: Verified the use of DWAVE to achieve a speedup in Machine Learning and combinatorial optimization problems. Worked on optimization of various problems - Feature Selection, Quantum Boosting, Restricted Boltzmann Machine, Map Coloring, Satisfiability problem and others using quantum annealing on NASA’s DWAVE computer. Please refer the pdf for some of my notes.
summary: Verified the use of DWAVE to achieve a speedup in Machine Learning and combinatorial optimization problems
title: Combinatorial Optimisation on DWAVE systems

content: Investigated overlap and parallels between quantum mechanics and stochastic mechanics. Study based on work by John C. Baez, Jacob Biamonte Please refer the pdf for the notes!
summary: Investigated overlap and parallels between quantum mechanics and stochastic mechanics.
title: Quantum Techniques for Stochastic Mechanics

summary: Designing and Constructing a 5-m aperture radio telescope (image for illustration)
title: Radio Telescope

content: A study based project inspecting quantum protocols which provide fully private assisted quantum computation. Please refer the pdf for the notes!
summary: A study based project inspecting quantum protocols which provide fully private assisted quantum computation.
title: Secure Quantum Computation

content: Synthesized fluorescent quantum Dots Please refer the pdf for the experimentation details.
summary: Short experimental project synthesizing and analysing quantum dots
title: Synthesis of Quantum Dots

content: Designed efficient quantum circuits for discrete time topological quantum walks for near term quantum computers. Details to be updated soon!
summary: Designed efficient quantum circuits for quantum walks
title: Quantum Circuit Design
